verdict.summary: Ingress resource references an IngressClass that doesn't exist. No ingress controller is installed or the class name is misspelled.

dead_ends.action: Remove the ingressClassName field from the Ingress
dead_ends.why_fails: Without an IngressClass, no controller will pick up the Ingress resource

dead_ends.action: Annotate the Ingress with deprecated kubernetes.io/ingress.class
dead_ends.why_fails: Annotation is deprecated in K8s 1.18+ and may not be supported by newer controllers

workarounds.action: Install an ingress controller (nginx, traefik, etc.) and verify its IngressClass is created
workarounds.how: helm install ingress-nginx ingress-nginx/ingress-nginx && kubectl get ingressclass

workarounds.action: Set the correct ingressClassName matching the installed controller
workarounds.how: kubectl get ingressclass to find available classes, then set spec.ingressClassName in the Ingress

leads_to.condition: when IngressClass is found but backend service is misconfigured

preceded_by.condition: when applying Ingress manifests with wrong apiVersion

frequently_confused_with.distinction: IngressClass not found means no controller is configured, while 502 means the controller exists but the backend is unreachable
